Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: SOD zeolite-like topology with alternating cage-window-cage shaped pores

Other Information.Additional Info: Na+ ions partially enter the membrane but cannot pass through due to small apertures.
Cl− ions primarily stay in large cavities and cannot transport across the membrane.

Other Information.Threshold Pressure: 2.5 MPa (osmotic pressure of 0.5 M NaCl solution)
Other Information.Additional Info: Water flux scales linearly with pressure difference and follows Arrhenius-type relation with temperature.

Sieving Mechanism: Small apertures (3.4 Å) block Na+ and Cl− ions while allowing water molecules to pass.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Water flux: up to 25 × 10^4 kg h⁻¹ m⁻² at 150 MPa; Activation energy: 24.4 kJ/mol

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-8 exhibits mechanical robustness and high water permeation but lower flux compared to CNT/BNNT membranes.
